author: jhoneill
body:
I have some code which takes a -grid switch and sends output to Out-gridView rather than sending it back down the pipeline as normal. 
To ensure the grid view closes when the test runs in a CI pipeline with no one watching, the test runs 
`PowerShell -command "blah blah" `
In recent previews of pwsh, out-gridview has returned. Which is **GREAT** My code works as it used to when run normally.  So now my test should be able to run 
`pwsh -command "blah blah"`
But now PowerShell waits for the grid view window to close before continuing. 
This might be by design so that scripts which show a grid don't immediately close , taking the grid with them or it may be a bug

Repro steps compare 
```powershell

powershell -command "ps | ogv ; sleep 5"



pwsh -command "ps | ogv ; sleep 5"

```

```none
Expected to match
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT

comments.author: jhoneill
comments.body:
This still exists, and seems to apply to other windows opened by Pwsh. 
` pwsh -command "Get-help -showwindow get-help ; sleep 5" ` will also produce the effect.
